instructions.title: How to use Base64 to JPG Converter

steps.title: Paste your Base64 string
steps.description: Copy and paste your Base64-encoded JPEG data into the input area. The tool automatically detects data URL prefixes and removes them if present.

steps.title: Validate Base64 format
steps.description: The tool automatically validates your Base64 input and shows estimated file size. It checks for valid JPEG headers to ensure data integrity.

steps.title: Set custom filename (optional)
steps.description: Customize the output filename if needed. You can use either .jpg or .jpeg extension. The tool auto-generates a timestamped filename by default for easy organization.

steps.title: Convert and preview
steps.description: Click 'Convert to JPEG' to process the data. The tool displays JPEG information including dimensions and quality estimation, and provides an instant preview before downloading.

steps.title: Download your JPEG
steps.description: Click 'Download JPEG' to save the converted image to your device. The preview ensures you're downloading the correct image.

troubleshooting: Invalid Base64 error: Ensure input contains only valid Base64 characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, +, /, =)
No JPEG header found: The data may be valid Base64 but not a JPEG image - check the source
Preview not showing: Check browser console for errors or try a smaller image
Memory issues: Try toggling preview off for very large JPEG files
Low quality warning: The JPEG may have high compression or be a small image
Wrong colors or artifacts: JPEG uses lossy compression which may introduce visual artifacts
